name: paternalist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone in authority who thinks or behaves in a way that results in them making decisions for other people rather than letting them take responsibility for their own lives: He was a paternalist who ruled wisely. They had a sincere, albeit paternalist, interest in Aboriginal welfare. See
paternalism
More examplesFewer examplesHe was a paternalist, providing his workforce with welfare services and housing.He was a benevolent paternalist, protecting the masses from themselves.His attitude to labour was that of an early nineteenth-century Tory paternalist.
